es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms

Class AbstractAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.uc3m.baldo.opinais.core.algorithms.AbstractAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EvolutionaryAlgorithm

    public abstract class AbstractAlgorithm
extends java.lang.Object
implements Algorithm

    Provides an abstract implementation of an algorithm.

    While this class does not actually implement the run functionality, it exists for commodity purposes, as most algorithms will share some common functionality, such as the initialization of random detectors, the stop condition; as well as common parameters.

    Author:
    Alejandro Baldominos

    • Field Detail

      • individuals

        protected java.util.Set<Individual> individuals

        Set containing the individuals.

      • detectors

        protected java.util.List<Detector> detectors

        List of detectors.

        A list is chosen rather than a set because most algorithms may prefer a sorted ADT to sort detectors based on some fitness measure.

      • featuresLength

        protected int featuresLength

        The number of features of each individual.

      • speciesSize

        protected int speciesSize

        The size of the detectors population.

      • typeBias

        protected double typeBias

        The probability that a randomly created detector detects self individuals.

      • generalityBias

        protected double generalityBias

        The probability that a bit in a randomly created detector is a wildcard.

      • maxGenerations

        protected int maxGenerations

        The maximum number of generations of the algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractAlgorithm

        public AbstractAlgorithm(int speciesSize,
                 double typeBias,
                 double generalityBias,
                 int maxGenerations)

        Initializes some fields common to most algorithms.

        Parameters:
        speciesSize - the size of the detectors population.
        typeBias - the probability that a randomly created detector detects self individuals.
        generalityBias - the probability that a bit in a randomly created detector is a wildcard.
        maxGenerations - the maximum number of generations of the algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • setIndividuals

        public void setIndividuals(java.util.Set<Individual> individuals)

        Sets the training individuals.

        Automatically retrieves the number of features of the individuals.

        Specified by:
        setIndividuals in interface Algorithm
        Parameters:
        individuals - set containing the individuals.

      • run

        public abstract java.util.Map<Type,Detector> run()

        Runs the AIS-based algorithm to retrieve a detector for each possible type.

        This method must be overriden and implemented by a child class.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Algorithm
        Returns:
        a map which maps a type to the best detector found by the algorithm for that type.

      • stop

        protected boolean stop(int generation)

        Decides whether the algorithm must stop.

        By default, the stop condition for an algorithm is that the maximum number of generations is achieved.

        Child classes may re-implement the stop condition or add new ones.

        Parameters:
        generation - the current generation.
        Returns:
        true if the algorithm must stop because the maximum number of generations has been already achieved, false otherwise.

      • initializePopulation

        protected void initializePopulation()

        Initializes a random population of detectors.
